targetAudience: Read 10+ books in 66 days. Perfect for those who 'want to read more' but never do.
scientificRationale: Reading rewires your brain: increased vocabulary, improved empathy (fiction), enhanced critical thinking, and expanded knowledge. But most people fail to build reading habits because they set unrealistic goals (1 hour daily). Research shows that 15-20 minutes of daily reading, tracked consistently for 66 days, creates automatic behavior. By pairing reading with journaling (reflection) and meditation (focus training), you maximize retention and comprehension.

challengeFAQs.question: How do I find time to read?
challengeFAQs.answer: You don't find time, you replace phone scrolling. Track your screen time—most people spend 3-4 hours daily on phones. Replace just 20-30 minutes with reading. Best times: morning (before phone distractions), lunch break, before bed (better sleep than scrolling). Reading becomes automatic when it has a specific time anchor.

challengeFAQs.question: What if I'm a slow reader?
challengeFAQs.answer: Doesn't matter. Reading 10 pages daily (even if it takes 30 min) still completes 10+ books in 66 days. Speed reading is overrated—comprehension and retention matter more. NooLife tracks pages read, not reading speed. Consistency beats speed every time.

challengeFAQs.question: How do I stay focused while reading?
challengeFAQs.answer: 1) Remove phone from room. 2) Start with just 10 pages (low barrier). 3) Use meditation before reading (10 min focus training). 4) Journal after reading (forces active engagement). 5) Pick genuinely interesting books (boredom kills habits). Focus improves dramatically by Week 3-4 as your attention span rebuilds.

challengeFAQs.question: What if I hate the book I'm reading?
challengeFAQs.answer: Switch books immediately. Life is too short for boring books. The goal is building the reading habit, not finishing every book you start. NooLife tracks reading consistency, not specific books. Give books 50 pages, then abandon guilt-free if not engaging. Keep reading something.

challengeFAQs.question: Should I read physical books, Kindle, or audiobooks?
challengeFAQs.answer: Whatever keeps you consistent. Physical books: best for focus and retention. Kindle: convenience, built-in dictionary, portability. Audiobooks: count during commutes/workouts (double productivity). NooLife tracks all formats. Most successful readers use combination based on context (physical at home, audio in car).
